> <OLD>
>
> There was a definite look of authority in his expression, as it was in the
> nature of the dragon to be a highly territorial creature.  In his spark, he
> could sense the old dragon's soul, and can understand that he at one time,
> must have done his best to keep ecological harmony in the jungle.  Due to
> his failing health he was unable to maintain his authority, and so chaos
> seemed to take the place of whatever balance the old dragon maintained.  But
> that would change.  The soul of the dragon is now Tucson's to keep.  So now
> he had another commitment to keep, he had to promise to keep the harmony and
> rid the jungle of chaos, as was the dragon's personal vow years ago.  That
> vow was now Tucson's.  So with a heavy thrust of his left front limb, he
> firmly puts his taloned foot down and gives a territorial roar.  Come what
> may he was going to rescue his comrades and win back what was stolen from
> Old Earth. There was no mistake, the Silver Dragon had returned to claim his
> place as the Jungle Guardian.

<NEW>

As the jungled reverberated with TUSCON's deep throated roar, birds of
all types spooked and rose into the air making all kinds of racket!
Ancient forms of monkeys and other assorted tree dwelling animals took
to flight as well raising a din of their own. They moved swiftly
aloong branches and tree limbs as the trees themselves shook and
rattled leaves vibrated and fell to the ground!

TUSCON's sonar while good at the very short distance did not avail him
much as they spread out. With all the trees and underbrush it was like
a human trying to peek into a house with the blinds closed, but in
this case the blinds were spread out several feet across. Even though
you could see past some of them, as the distance increase even
TUSCON's sonar was obscured.

However one thing he did pick up was four large shapes moving towards
him, each of them fully as large as he was! While his sonar was not as
adept as it once was, his enhanced senses were also helping him as
they picked up the loud crashing sounds of footsteps of the creatures
as they approached him and trees cracking and bending as they passed
by them.

TUSCON was still standing at the edge of the clearing, the terminated
sweep still at his feet, the lubricant leakage had finally stopped.
The shapes were coming from further into the jungle, they were perhaps
several hundred yards away. It was only because of their size and the
fact that they were taking no precautions to hide their approach that
he could detect them at this distance. They were moving straight in
TUSCON's direction.

(TAG)

Preston
